title: Combination Sum II
description:
Combination Sum II

Leetcode 40. Combination Sum II

You are given an array of integers `candidates`, which may contain duplicates, and a target integer `target`. Your task is to return a list of all **unique combinations** of `candidates` where the chosen numbers sum to `target`.

Each element from `candidates` may be chosen **at most once** within a combination. The solution set must not contain duplicate combinations.

You may return the combinations in **any order** and the order of the numbers in each combination can be in **any order**.

Examples:

  • Input: candidates = [9,2,2,4,6,1,5], target = 8

    Output: [
    [1,2,5],
    [2,2,4],
    [2,6]
    ]
  • Input: candidates = [1,2,3,4,5], target = 7

    Output: [
    [1,2,4],
    [2,5],
    [3,4]
    ]

Constraints:

  • `1 <= candidates.length <= 100`
  • `1 <= candidates[i] <= 50`
  • `1 <= target <= 30`

python.solution_text:
Backtracking Solution for Combination Sum II:

Find all unique combinations that sum to target (no duplicates, each element used once).

Algorithm:

  1. Sort candidates to handle duplicates efficiently
  2. Use backtracking to explore combinations
  3. Skip duplicate elements at same recursion level
  4. Each element can be used at most once

Key Insights:

  • Sort array first to group duplicates
  • Skip duplicates: if i > start and candidates[i] == candidates[i-1], continue
  • Use start index to prevent reusing earlier elements

Time Complexity: O(2^n) in worst case

Space Complexity: O(target) for recursion depth
